data.name: set_timebase_scale
data.description: Sets the time per division for the main time base.

data.name: set_timebase_mode_xy
data.description: XY displays the voltage of channel 1 (horizontal axis) against the voltage of channel 2 (vertical axis). NOTE: Setting the display format to XY turns cursors off. Sending the CURSor:FUNCtion command when the display format is XY causes the oscilloscope to generate event 221 (Settings conflict) and leaves the display in XY format.

data.name: set_timebase_mode_yt
data.description: YT sets the display to vertical values versus time format and is the default mode.

data.name: set_timebase_x_channel_ch1
data.description: Timebase x on channel 1

data.name: set_timebase_x_channel_ch2
data.description: Timebase x on channel 2

data.name: set_timebase_y_channel_ch1
data.description: Timebase y on channel 1

data.name: set_timebase_y_channel_ch2
data.description: Timebase y on channel 2

data.name: get_is_in_acquisitions_state
data.description: Ask if it's in acquisitions state

data.name: stop_acquisitions
data.description: Stop all acquisitions

data.name: set_acquisition_mode_sample
data.description: SAMple specifies that the displayed data point value is the first sampled value that was taken during the acquisition interval. The waveform data has 8 bits of precision in all acquisition modes. You can request 16 bit data with a CURVe? query, but the lower-order 8 bits of data will be zero. SAMple is the default mode.

data.name: set_acquisition_mode_peakdetect
data.description: PEAKdetect specifies the display of the high-low range of the samples taken from a single waveform acquisition. The oscilloscope displays the high-low range as a vertical range that extends from the highest to the lowest value sampled during the acquisition interval. PEAKdetect mode can reveal the presence of aliasing.

data.name: set_acquisition_mode_average
data.description: AVErage specifies averaging mode, where the resulting waveform shows an average of SAMple data points from several separate waveform acquisitions. The number of waveform acquisitions that go into making up the average waveform is set or queried using the ACQuire:NUMAVg command.

data.name: get_acquisition_mode
data.description: Ask for acquisition mode

data.name: set_average_acquisition_mode_samples_amount_4
data.description: Sets the number of oscilloscope waveform acquisitions that make up an averaged waveform to 4

data.name: set_average_acquisition_mode_samples_amount_16
data.description: Sets the number of oscilloscope waveform acquisitions that make up an averaged waveform to 16

data.name: set_average_acquisition_mode_samples_amount_64
data.description: Sets the number of oscilloscope waveform acquisitions that make up an averaged waveform to 64

data.name: set_average_acquisition_mode_samples_amount_128
data.description: Sets the number of oscilloscope waveform acquisitions that make up an averaged waveform to 128

data.name: force_trigger
data.description: Force trigger

data.name: set_trigger_mode_auto
data.description: AUTO generates a trigger if a trigger is not detected within a specific time period. AUTO also enables scan mode for sweep speeds of 100 ms/div and slower.

data.name: set_trigger_mode_normal
data.description: NORMal waits for a valid trigger event.

data.name: set_trigger_type_edge
data.description: EDGE is a normal trigger. A trigger event occurs when a signal passes through a specified voltage level in the specified direction and is controlled by the TRIGger:MAIn:EDGE commands.

data.name: set_trigger_type_video
data.description: VIDeo specifies that a trigger occurs when a specified signal is found and is controlled by the TRIGger:MAIn:VIDeo commands.

data.name: set_trigger_type_pulse
data.description: PULse specifies that a trigger occurs when the specified signal meets the pulse width criteria that is controlled by the TRIGger: MAIn:PULse commands.

data.name: get_trigger_type
data.description: Get trigger type

data.name: set_trigger_edge_type_fall
data.description: FALL specifies to trigger on the falling or negative edge of a signal.

data.name: set_trigger_edge_type_rise
data.description: RISe specifies to trigger on the rising or positive edge of a signal.

data.name: set_trigger_edge_source_ch1
data.description: CH1 specifies channel 1 as source.

data.name: set_trigger_edge_source_ch2
data.description: CH2 specifies channel 2 as source.

data.name: set_trigger_edge_source_ext
data.description: EXT specifies the external input.

data.name: set_trigger_edge_source_ext5
data.description: EXT5 specifies that the external input is attenuated by a factor of 5.

data.name: set_trigger_edge_source_acline
data.description: AC LINE specifies the power line signal as a trigger source.

data.name: set_trigger_level
data.description: Sets de oscilloscope edge and pulse width trigger level.

data.name: get_waveform_data
data.description: Transfers oscilloscope waveform data to and from the oscilloscope in binary or ASCII format. Each waveform that is transferred has an associated waveform preamble that contains information such as data format and scale.

data.name: set_waveform_bytes_width_1
data.description: Sets 1 byte per waveform data point to be transferred when executing the CURVe command.

data.name: set_waveform_bytes_width_2
data.description: Sets 2 bytes per waveform data point to be transferred when executing the CURVe command.

data.name: set_waveform_encoding_ascii
data.description: ASCIi specifies the ASCII representation of signed integer (RIBinary) data. If this is the value at power-on, the WFMPre values for BN_Fmt, BYT_Or, and ENCdg are set as RP, MSB, and ASC respectively

data.name: set_waveform_encoding_ribinary
data.description:
RIBinary specifies signed integer data-point representation with the most significant byte transferred first. This format results in the fastest data transfer rate when DATa:WIDth is set to 2. 
The range is –128 to 127 when DATa:WIDth is 1. Zero is center screen. The range is –32768 to 32767 when DATa:WIDth is 2. The upper limit is one division above the top of the screen and the lower limit is one division below the bottom of the screen.

data.name: set_waveform_encoding_rpbinary
data.description:
RPBinary specifies positive integer data-point representation with the most significant byte transferred first. 
The range is 0 to 255 when DATa:WIDth is 1. Center screen is 127. The range is 0 to 65,535 when DATa:WIDth is 2. The upper limit is one division above the top of the screen and the lower limit is one division below the bottom of the screen.

data.name: set_waveform_encoding_sribinary
data.description: SRIbinary is the same as RIBinary except that the byte order is swapped, meaning that the least significant byte is transferred first. This format is useful when transferring data to IBM compatible PCs.

data.name: set_waveform_encoding_srpbinary
data.description: SRPbinary is the same as RPBinary except that the byte order is swapped, meaning that the least significant byte is transferred first. This format is useful when transferring data to IBM compatible PCs.

data.name: get_waveform_encoding
data.description: Get waveform encoding

data.name: set_waveform_source_ch1
data.description: Sets Channel 1 to be the waveform source data

data.name: set_waveform_source_ch2
data.description: Sets Channel 2 to be the waveform source data

data.name: set_waveform_source_math
data.description: Sets MATH to be the waveform source data

data.name: set_waveform_source_refa
data.description: Sets REF A to be the waveform source data

data.name: set_waveform_source_refb
data.description: Sets REF B to be the waveform source data

data.name: set_waveform_points_format_env
data.description:
ENV specifies that the oscilloscope transmit the waveform as minimum and maximum point pairs. Peak detect waveforms use ENV format. Peak Detect mode specifies a maximum of 1250 (minimum, maximum) pairs, with the time between pairs being 2*XINcr.
The magnitudes and times of ENV format waveform points can be calculated using the same formulas used for Y format, as long as you recognize that the points consist of (minimum, maximum) pairs, where each pair was collected over a time period of 2*XINcr.
Thus, the samples for n=0 (a minimum) and n=1 (a maximum), the first (minimum, maximum) pair, were collected over a time interval of width 2*XINcr, that began at the time found by setting n to zero in the formula. The next pair were collected over the interval that began at the time found by setting n to 2 in the formula, and so on.

data.name: set_waveform_points_format_y
data.description:
Y specifies a normal waveform where one ASCII or binary data point is transmitted for each point in the waveform record. 
For Y format, the time (absolute coordinate) of a point, relative to the trigger, can be calculated using the following formula. N ranges from 0 to 2499. 
Xn = XZEro + XINcr (n - PT_OFf) 
For Y format, the magnitude (usually voltage, relative to ground) (absolute coordinate) of a point can be calculated: 
Yn = YZEro + YMUIty (yn - YOFf)
